cards.title: From Nô to Mata Hari / The art of Asian theatre costume
cards.rawTitle: The art of Asian theatre costume

item.title: The art of Asian theatre costume
item.trailText: From Nô to Mata Hari, the ambitious exhibition in Paris, exploring 2000 years of Asian theatre
item.standFirst: From Nô to Mata Hari, the ambitious exhibition exploring 2000 years of Asian theatre at the Musée Guimet, Paris, until 31 August 2015.

displayImages.caption: Mask and costume for Tosakanth from Thailand, featured in From Nô to Mata Hari, an exhibition exploring the immense variety of costumes from Asian theatrical productions. Photograph: Thierry Ollivier / RMN-GP/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: Mask and costume for Tosakanth, Thailand.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Mask and costume for Tosakanth from Thailand, featured in From Nô to Mata Hari, an exhibition exploring the immense variety of costumes from Asian theatrical productions.

displayImages.caption: Women’s ceremonial costume (uchikake) from a Kabuki theatre production in Japan. Photograph: Thierry Ollivier/RMN-GP/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: Women’s ceremonial costume (uchikake) from the Japanese theatre Kabuki.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Women’s ceremonial costume (uchikake) from a Kabuki theatre production in Japan.

displayImages.caption: A character from a version of Legend of the White Snake, performed in Guangdong, China. Photograph: Thierry Ollivier/RMN-GP/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: A character from the Chinese Legend of the White Snake: Blue Snake
displayImages.cleanCaption: A character from a version of Legend of the White Snake, performed in Guangdong, China.

displayImages.caption: The made up face of a Kathakali actor, the ancient theatre form, which originated in Kerala, India. Photograph: Suzanne Held/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: The made up face of a Kathakali actor
displayImages.cleanCaption: The made up face of a Kathakali actor, the ancient theatre form, which originated in Kerala, India.

displayImages.caption: Female character from Dixi theatre in Guizhou, China. Photograph: Thierry Ollivier/RMN-GP/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: Female character from a Dixi theatre performance in Guizhou, China.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Female character from Dixi theatre in Guizhou, China.

displayImages.caption: Marionettes from the Wayang Golek theatre, Indonesia Photograph: Thierry Ollivier/RMN-GP/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: Marionettes from the Wayang Golek theatre style, Indonesia.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Marionettes from the Wayang Golek theatre, Indonesia

displayImages.caption: A scene depicting the coronation of Rama, Thanjavur (Tanjore), India. Photograph: Thierry Ollivier/RMN-GP/Musée Guimet
displayImages.altText: The coronation of Rama, Thanjavur (Tanjore), India
displayImages.cleanCaption: A scene depicting the coronation of Rama, Thanjavur (Tanjore), India.
